The two-year ordeal of Gaza's Nasser Hospital
subhead: The Israeli army's relentless targeting of Nasser Hospital has shed light on the true nature of the war it has waged against the Palestinian enclave since October 2023, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: Palestinian prisoners to be freed after all Gaza hostages confirmed to be in Israel, says PM's office
subhead: Under the terms of a plan aimed at ending the war in Gaza, Hamas is to release by Monday noon the remaining 47 hostages (living and dead) who were abducted on October 7, 2023.

title: Côte d'Ivoire's opposition is repressed as the presidential election campaign begins
subhead: While President Alassane Ouattara, who is running for a fourth term in office, held a major rally in the center of the country, the two main opposition parties were unable to stage their own events.

title: Flexing one's muscles: The new way of doing politics
subhead: Some politicians now openly display their muscles, both to win over voters and to establish a physical contrast with their rivals. This breaks with the French democratic tradition, which has long favored minds over bodies.

title: Canada's hottest village lives on despite the constant fear of wildfires
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (2/6) Lytton, British Columbia, was consumed by flames in 2021. As the fires have grown ever more destructive, some residents have returned, determined to stay.
